text: Henricus Cornelis Maria "Henk" Krol (born 1 April 1950 in Tilburg) is a former Dutch journalist, businessman, and politician of 50PLUS (50+), the Party for the Future (PvdT), and the Henk Krol List (HKL). He was political leader of 50+ from 2012 to 2020 (succeeded by Liane den Haan). He is gay and an LGBT rights activist. He was a member and parliamentary leader of the Second Chamber from 2012 to 2013, and from 2014 to 2021. Previously he was a member of the Provincial States of North Brabant and councillor of the municipality of Eindhoven. Krol studied psychology at the Free University Amsterdam. He was spokesman of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD) parliamentary group from 1978 to 1985. Meanwhile, in 1979, he founded the LGBT newspaper Gay Krant, for which he also worked as a journalist. He was also owner of the Best Publishing Group (publishing company of the Gay Krant) and online sex shop Gaytel, which went bankrupt in 2013. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Dutch LGBT rights activists Category:Dutch businesspeople Category:Dutch councillors Category:Dutch journalists Category:Dutch LGBT writers Category:Dutch provincial politicians Category:Leaders of political parties in the Netherlands Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Gay men Category:Independent politicians in the Netherlands Category:LGBT businesspeople Category:LGBT journalists Category:Dutch LGBT politicians Category:LGBT sex industry people Category:People from Tilburg Category:Politicians from North Brabant Category:Sex industry businesspeople Category:Writers from North Brabant
title: Henk Krol
